Package danogl.components

Class Transition<T>

java.lang.Object
danogl.components.Transition<T>
Type Parameters:
T - The value's type
All Implemented Interfaces:
Component
public class Transition<T>
extends java.lang.Object
implements Component
Transition a value over a range
Author:
Dan Nirel

    Nested Classes 
    Modifier and Type Class Description
    static interface  Transition.Interpolator<T>
    Represents an interpolator, which receives an initial value, a final value, and a t parameter between 0 and 1, and returns the in-between value at t
    static class  Transition.TransitionType
    Type of transition

  • Field Details

    • LINEAR_INTERPOLATOR_FLOAT

      public static final Transition.Interpolator<java.lang.Float> LINEAR_INTERPOLATOR_FLOAT
      A built-in linear interpolator for floats. The transition will advance from the initial value to the final in a straight line.

    • LINEAR_INTERPOLATOR_VECTOR

      public static final Transition.Interpolator<Vector2> LINEAR_INTERPOLATOR_VECTOR
      A built-in linear interpolator for Vector2. Each axis will advance from the initial value to the final in a straight line.

    • CUBIC_INTERPOLATOR_FLOAT

      public static final Transition.Interpolator<java.lang.Float> CUBIC_INTERPOLATOR_FLOAT
      A built-in cubit interpolator for floats. Will start slowly from the initial value, accelerate, then slow when approaching its goal.

    • CUBIC_INTERPOLATOR_VECTOR

      public static final Transition.Interpolator<Vector2> CUBIC_INTERPOLATOR_VECTOR
      A built-in cubit interpolator for Vector2. Will start slowly from the initial value, accelerate, then slow when approaching its goal.

  • Constructor Details

    • Transition

      public Transition​(GameObject gameObjectToUpdateThrough, java.util.function.Consumer<T> setValueCallback, T initialValue, T finalValue, Transition.Interpolator<T> interpolator, float transitionTime, Transition.TransitionType transitionType, java.lang.Runnable onReachingFinalValue)
      Create a new Transition. After creating the transition it will immediately be applied. There might not be any need for the reference to the created object.
      Parameters:
      gameObjectToUpdateThrough - The transition will leech onto this object to get its update method called. It doesn't really matter which object is supplied here, as long as the object itself lives for at least as long as the transition should. Therefore it makes sense to send the GameObject most associated with this transition.
      setValueCallback - During the transition, it will traverse over a range of values. Each such value will be sent to this callback. Effectively, this is the method that actually changes the required attribute. In a normal setting, unless using a very specialized interpolator, the transition is meaningless without this callback that applies the value to something external.
      initialValue - The value to start from.
      finalValue - A final value (the other edge value).
      interpolator - A function to interpolate between the edge values. Most cases will find the built-in interpolators (declared as constants of the class) sufficient.
      transitionTime - The time for a single transition from edge to edge, in seconds.
      transitionType - Type of transition.
      onReachingFinalValue - A function to be called every time the transition reached the final value.
      See Also:
      Transition.TransitionType, Transition.Interpolator

  • Method Details

    • update

      public void update​(float deltaTime)
      Description copied from interface: Component
      When the a GameObject is assigned this component, it calls this method in every update
      Specified by:
      update in interface Component
      Parameters:
      deltaTime - the time, in seconds, since the previous update
